greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to fill a matrix with the parts of the integer partition with Heinz number n.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1, ..., y_k) is prime(y_1) * ... * prime(y_k).
example: The a(24) = 12 matrices whose entries are (2,1,1,1):
xref: Positions of 1's are one and prime numbers A008578.
Positions of 2's are primes to prime powers A053810.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jan 12 2019
